intro: Petesia carnosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf morning glory, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple, often blooming in the morning. Petesia carnosa is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many flowering vines and herbs. It is often found in moist, tropical environments and can be invasive in some regions.
